answers.answer: Hi,I too am RH neg and developed antibodies after my first pregnancy. I also didn't get the Rhogam shot, I have had several miscarriages since then which are blamed on other hormones but I think the my antibodies do have something to do with it. One thing to note is that bleeding in pregnancy is quite common and sometimes not a problem, always best to check with a dr though. I bled on and off with my son and he was fine, problems developed later in the pregnancy but it had nothing to do with the bleeding. Pregnant women who haven't had the Rhogam shot usually get an injection to suppress the antibodies around 16 weeks, and sometimes again at around 7/8 months, insist on getting the Rhogam 2 days after delivery at the latest, don't let them talk you out of it for whatever reason, it's much easier the next time around once you've had it.Hope that helps!Have a happy and healthy 9 months!
